intro: Chthamalia humifusa, commonly known as the rockweed, is a species of marine algae belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It is typically found in intertidal zones, growing on rocky substrates in coastal areas. The plant has a flattened, thallus-like structure with a dark green to brownish coloration. It plays an important role in coastal ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine organisms. Chthamalia humifusa is adapted to withstand tidal fluctuations and moderate salinity levels.
